Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit an RBI single
Will Smith hit a two-run homer
Gavin Lux hit a two-run homer
Ryan Brasier and seven other relievers held the Padres to seven hits
Evan Phillips retired Jurickson Profar, Manny Machado, and Jackson Merrill on five pitches in the sixth
Mookie Betts drove in two runs on two hits
Shohei Ohtani hit a tying three-run homer off Cease in his playoff debut
Pre-Game Insights: The winner will have home-field advantage in the National League Championship Series against the New York Mets
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts expressed pride in the team's resilience
Freddie Freeman was sidelined by a right ankle sprain
Miscellaneous Highlights: San Diego Padres won 10-2 at Dodger Stadium in Game 2
Tempers flared on the field and in the stands during the previous game
Padres' gamble to start Cease on short rest backfired
All-Star first baseman Freddie Freeman was sidelined by a right ankle sprain
Mookie Betts snapped an 0-for-22 playoff slump with his homer
Shohei Ohtani became the first member of the 50-50 club this season with 54 homers and 59 stolen bases
Others: Padres' gamble to start Cease on short rest backfired
Fernando Tatis Jr. was kept in the yard despite hitting three homers in the first three games
